intro: Sida bicallosa, commonly known as sand mat, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its small, white to yellowish flowers and hairy, often pubescent leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or disturbed soils and is often found in coastal areas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Sida bicallosa is an annual or perennial herb that can spread through seeds and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
